item.title: Towards Social Learning Agents for Education
item.description: Collaborative learning is interactive and allows for shared meaning making. One form of collaborative learning is learning with AI agents. How can we develop AI agents which learn from and socialize with human peers to teach new concepts? We propose to equip agents with a reward model for social reward as an intrinsic motivation to learn from others.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Models of Tradeoffs Between Infant Attachment and Curiosity
item.description: Member abstract at CogSci 2023. How can we computationally model infant learning and attachment styles?

item.title: Characterizing Learning Progress of Problem-Solvers Using Puzzle-Solving Log Data
item.description: Demo paper at EDM 2023. How do human learners perform on a puzzle video game compared to AI learners?

item.title: A Few Words on Applying to Grad School
item.description: Many people have already written sage advice for applying to graduate school. If you’re looking for some pointers, here’s a good place to start: Grad School Resources by Kalpesh Krishna (linked to from Nelson Liu’s Student Perspectives on Applying to NLP PhD Programs). There’s also a scrappy list of related links here from my “Resources” page.

item.title: terminal-jellies: Jellies, in your terminal
item.description: Demo with example levels loaded The game 2022-05-18 review endpreamble Made in the winter of 2019, inspired by the Jellies puzzle game. morecontent Having played this variation on Jelly no Puzzle and other cutesy puzzle games I’d stumble across back then, like marblesgame, I decided to make my own clone of the former. It was the middle of midterms and honestly the most fun (and only) weekend spurt of coding I had in a long while.

item.title: Uber ATG Research Scientist
item.description: At Uber ATG Toronto (now Waabi) in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. endpreamble Demonstrated a data-driven pipeline for the photorealistic video simulation of cars inserted into urban driving scenes.

item.title: Intro to Statistics for Data Science / Machine Learning
item.description: The second of two talks on linear algebra and statistics in machine learning, joint with Anzo Teh.

item.title: Variational Autoencoders
item.description: In addition to research and internship opportunities, I learned about AI through reading and summarizing blog posts and papers, then giving talks like this one.

item.title: Combinatorics & Optimization Undergraduate Research Intern
item.description: At University of Waterloo C&O Department in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada. endpreamble Extended a result from graph theory in an attempt to resolve a conjecture in extremal combinatorics.

item.title: Uber ATG R&D Intern
item.description: At Uber ATG Toronto (now Waabi) in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. endpreamble Implemented a hardcoded baseline for the photorealistic image simulation of cars inserted into urban driving scenes.

item.title: Petuum Software Engineering Intern
item.description: At enterprise machine learning startup Petuum in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA. endpreamble Researched efficient distributed learning algorithms for neural networks and machine learning models.

item.title: Siri NL Machine Learning Intern
item.description: At Apple Campus in Cupertino, California, USA. endpreamble Developed an app to help data scientists visualize how AI models performed on text.

item.title: syncflowy: a synergistic cross between Google Docs and Workflowy
item.description: Dredged these two videos up from an old USB back when Macbooks still came with USB-A ports. I’m sad to say I don’t have any videos of the more interesting operations. The unit tests covered them, mind you! endpreamble Based on operational transform as described in the Jupiter collaborative system. morecontent Made with Redis, NodeJS, and MongoDB.

item.description: An implementation of Kazemi et al.’s One Millisecond Face Alignment With An Ensemble of Regression Trees.
